intro: Scaligeria samarkandica, commonly known as the Samarkand scaleria, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional medicine. Scaligeria samarkandica thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties.
